pages.text: Are you getting frustrated by the large range of your $(l:mechanics/prospecting)Prospector's Pick$()? Tired of digging around clueless as to the location of your riches? Well, despair no more, for the $(thing)Prospector's Hammer$() can help!

The Prospector's Hammer is a $(t:In more ways than one!)near copy$() of its pick-y brother, with the notable exception of a smaller range, only searching the 13x13x13 area centered on the block inspected and slightly less accuracy overall. Very useful for finding veins that appear to be all around you.
Much like with a Prospector's Pick, a Prospector's Hammer Head Mold can be made from $(l:getting_started/pottery)knapping$() some clay as shown above.

Then, the mold can be $(l:mechanics/heating)fired$() to create a $(thing)Prospector's Hammer Head Mold$().$(br2)To create the tool head, $(l:getting_started/finding_ores#casting)cast$() liquid metal into the mold.

A Prospector's Hammer Head can also be $(l:mechanics/anvils#working)smithed$() out of a $(thing)double ingot$() of any tool metal on an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$(). Craft the tool head with a stick to make a Prospector's Hammer
Note that it will be rare to see a Prospector's Hammer report finding a $(thing)Very Large Sample$(), due to its reduced range.
